page.title: 08The School Outing
page.content: On 2nd July 38 children and 9 adults went to "Bekonscot" near Beaconsfield to walk through the model village.It had a church and a windmill,a castle and some trains. We were amazed at the hard work that must have gone into the making of those buildings. Then we got back on the coach and went to Windsor.We got on a large boat which we had to ourselves.We had our picnic lunch as the boat sailed to Maidenhead.It took 1.5 hours to travel 7 miles.We went through two locks and were fascinated to see the boat rising as the water level changed.We saw moorhens and ducks and geese and weirs and fishermen. The day was sunny and warm so we did not need our coats.We bought drinks on the boat and threw our crumbs to the ducks.We got back at 3p.m.
